com.simbachain.wallet

Class FileWallet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simbachain.wallet.Wallet
      • com.simbachain.wallet.FileWallet

  • public class FileWallet
extends Wallet
    File based Wallet implementation. This supports standard wallet files as well as Bip39 wallets that have an associated mnemonic.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Create a FileWallet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileWallet

        public FileWallet(java.lang.String directory,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Create a FileWallet. The directory is the root path to where you store keys. The name parameter is used to create a subdirectory under the root. It is under the name subdirectory that a single wallet file lives. That file will have the name of the current UTC timestamp and the address in it. NOTE: The name parameter may get mangled to ensure a valid directory name is used.
        Parameters:
        directory - root directory
        name - sub directory for locating a single wallet file.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteWallet

        public boolean deleteWallet()
                     throws SimbaException
        Delete the wallet.
        Returns:
        This returns true if deletion succeeds, false if it fails.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs during the attempt to delete.

      • generateWallet

        public java.lang.String generateWallet(java.lang.String passkey)
                                throws SimbaException
        Generate a new Wallet.
        Parameters:
        passkey - the password used for the Wallet.
        Returns:
        The location of the created Wallet. What this actually represents is dependent on the Wallet implementation.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs.

      • generateMnemonicWallet

        public java.lang.String generateMnemonicWallet(java.lang.String passkey)
                                        throws SimbaException
        Generate a Wallet that can be recreated elsewhere with a mnemonic. Once this method completes, the getMnemonic function will return the mnemonic used when generating the wallet. This is the only circumstance under which the getMnemonic method will not return null.
        Parameters:
        passkey - the password to use.
        Returns:
        return the location of the Wallet.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs.

      • generateMnemonicWallet

        public java.lang.String generateMnemonicWallet(java.lang.String passkey,
                                               java.lang.String mnemonic)
                                        throws SimbaException
        Generate a Wallet that can be recreated elsewhere with a mnemonic. Once this method completes, the getMnemonic function will return null as the client already knows it.
        Parameters:
        passkey - the password to use.
        mnemonic - the mnemonic to use.
        Returns:
        return the location of the Wallet.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs.

      • loadWallet

        public java.lang.String loadWallet(java.lang.String passkey)
                            throws SimbaException
        Load the Wallet using the password.
        Parameters:
        passkey - The password for the Wallet.
        Returns:
        The location of the Wallet.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs

        public java.lang.String loadMnemonicWallet(java.lang.String mnemonic)
                                    throws SimbaException
        Load the Wallet using the password.
        Parameters:
        mnemonic - The mnemonic for the Wallet.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getMnemonic

        public java.lang.String getMnemonic()
                             throws SimbaException
        If the Wallet was created with a mnemonic that was not supplied by the client, this will be returned.
        Returns:
        The mnemonic of the wallet if create as a Bip32 Wallet.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs

      • walletExists

        public boolean walletExists()
                     throws SimbaException
        Check if the Wallet exists and could be loaded. This checks if a wallet file exists.
        Returns:
        Return true if the Wallet exists, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs.

        Specified by:
        getCredentials in class Wallet
        Returns:

      • loadOrCreateWallet

        public java.lang.String loadOrCreateWallet(java.lang.String passkey)
                                    throws SimbaException
        Convenience method to check if the Wallet exists and if not, create it. Then try to load it.
        Parameters:
        passkey - The password to possibly create and then load the Wallet.
        Returns:
        The location of the Wallet.
        Throws:
        SimbaException - if an error occurs.
